perturbation.original_text: Subject to paragraph 6, MediaLinx shall be entitled to sell advertising and sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to Canadian advertisers (for the purposes of this Agreement "Canadian advertisers" shall be advertisers with substantial places of business in Canada) and HCI shall be entitled to sell advertising and sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to US advertisers (for the purposes of this Agreement, US advertisers shall be advertisers with substantial places of business in the United States).
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to paragraph 6, MediaLinx shall be entitled to sell advertising and sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to Canadian advertisers (for the purposes of this Agreement "Canadian advertisers" shall be advertisers who occasionally conduct business in Canada) and HCI shall be entitled to sell advertising and sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to US advertisers (for the purposes of this Agreement, US advertisers shall be advertisers who infrequently conduct business in the United States).
perturbation.explanation: The change replaces "substantial places of business" with "occasionally conduct business" for Canadian advertisers and "infrequently conduct business" for U.S. advertisers, creating a legal contradiction. The original definition implies a significant business presence, while the altered definitions are vague. This introduces ambiguity, as it doesn't specify the extent or nature of business activities required to qualify as a 'Canadian' or 'US' advertiser, thus conflicting with the legal understanding that requires a clear definition.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Definition of 'substantial business presence'

perturbation.original_text: Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be collected and used in accordance with Canadian federal and provincial laws and U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx will not have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site) during or after the Term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be collected and used at the discretion of both parties regardless of Canadian federal and provincial laws and U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx may have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site) during and after the Term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the data must be collected and used in accordance with privacy laws. The revised text indicates the data is used at the discretion of both parties, essentially ignoring the Canadian and U.S. privacy laws. Also, in the original text, MediaLinx would not have access, while the modified text indicates that they may. The changes contradict established privacy laws.

perturbation.original_text: It is the intention of MLX and HCI that MLX and HCI are, and shall be deemed to be, independent contractors with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement, and nothing contained in this Agreement shall be deemed or construed in any manner whatsoever as creating any partnership, joint venture, employment, agency, fiduciary or other similar relationship between MLX and HCI.
perturbation.changed_text: It is the intention of MLX and HCI that MLX and HCI are, and shall be deemed to be, independent contractors with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement, and the agreement may imply a partnership, joint venture, employment, agency, fiduciary or other similar relationship between MLX and HCI.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states no partnership or similar relationship is created. The changed text introduces uncertainty by suggesting the agreement may imply such a relationship. This contradicts the initial clear statement of independent contractor status, creating a potential legal ambiguity regarding the nature of the relationship. The reclassification could be used to enforce different labor laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Interpretation of 'Independent Contractor' status
